item.title: Operating Systems Concepts: Paging
item.description: Why do we need paging? In operating systems paging is used to elimiate the need for contigous physical memory. By using virtual memory with paging we can use blocks in the computer’s physical memory instead of using a contigous section. But still why does this matter? Just look at figure above. If we only use contingous blocks of memory we might be taking away memory that can be used to run other programs.
